reasoning: Hereditary ovarian cancer (primarily BRCA1/BRCA2-associated) accounts for approximately 5-10% of all ovarian cancers. Global ovarian cancer incidence is ~25-30 per 100k; hereditary cases represent ~2-3 per 100k person-years based on BRCA prevalence (1 in 300-500) and penetrance. Confidence moderate due to variation in BRCA screening coverage and genetic heterogeneity.
source: Estimated from epidemiological patterns in cancer registries; GLOBOCAN ovarian cancer data combined with BRCA prevalence estimates
